page.title: 10GRANDPARENTS' MEMORIES
page.content: Etwall has changed a lot, it used to be a tiny village. It has not only grown in the number of people but also in the number of buildings. There used to be only a few shops. Many things you wanted to buy had to be obtained from Derby or Burton. The houses have changed a lot too. There were mainly cottages and, if you were lucky,a farm which was usually passed from generation to generation. The cottages have been pulled down now and replaced with a mixture of fairly modern houses. People were attracted to Etwall because each house had its own water pump. The main road has always been here but not so busy because there was only the odd car the rest were only ponies and traps. The old railway used to work so people went on holiday and day trips by train.
